In a quiet village, everyone knew the old man and his loyal dog, Rufus. Each evening, Rufus would bark fiercely at the moon, warning of unseen dangers. One night, however, Rufus remained silent. The villagers, uneasy, gathered to investigate. They found the old man slumped in his chair, unresponsive. Without his barks, they realized Rufus was not just a dog; he was a guardian. The villagers rushed to help, and as they revived the old man, Rufusâ€™s silence transformed into a low whimper. From that night on, the villagers learned to listen not just to barks but to the silence that speaks volumes.
